column1: Coffee, tea, and cocoa: Per capita availability

1Prior to 1930,  except for the war years, 1917-1919, resient population only; from 1930 and thereafter, resident population plus the Armed Forces overseas. 2Quantity processed for soluble use minus net exports. 3Computed from unrounded numbers. 4Chocolate liquor is what remains after cocoa beans have been roasted and dehulled; it is sometimes called ground or bitter chocolate.

Source: Calculated by ERS/USDA based on data from various sources (see http://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/food-availability-(per-capita)-data-system/food-availability-documentation.aspx). Data last updated Feb. 1, 2016.
